creator: eagle250@mail.ru
text:
If tested server has alias-name (not ip-address or domain name), script doesn't record with HTTP Proxy Server in Internet Explorer 6.

About Internet Explorer:
Version: 6.0.2900.5512.xpsp_sp3_gdr.080814-1236
Cipher Strength: 128-bit
Product I  :76487-641-3648115-23853
Update Versions:; SP3;

The current version of JMeter is 2.3.2 - does it work OK with that?

What do you mean by "does not record" ?

Are any test elements created?

Does the browser show the correct pages?

Are there any errors reported in jmeter.log or the console?

Are you sure that the browser is correctly set up to use the JMeter proxy?
If you switch off the proxy, does the browser still work?
If so, then the browser proxy has not been set up correctly.
creator: sebb@apache.org
eagle250@mail.ru
text:
(In reply to comment #1)
> The current version of JMeter is 2.3.2 - does it work OK with that?
No. Current version have this bug.

> What do you mean by "does not record" ?
I mean, that JMeter didn't add new actions/requests/etc to the thread group, when i doing something (click links, push buttons) in Internet Explorer.

> Are any test elements created?
No

> Does the browser show the correct pages?
Yes. Browser show absolutely correct pages.

> Are there any errors reported in jmeter.log or the console?
Console didn't reported about errors. Sorry, I can't say about log, now.

> Are you sure that the browser is correctly set up to use the JMeter proxy?
Yes. 
My JMeter's configuration record script for server, which have domain name. (for all browsers)
My JMeter's configuration record script for server, which name is alias. (for FireFox 3 and Opera 9.63)

> If you switch off the proxy, does the browser still work?
No.
 
> If so, then the browser proxy has not been set up correctly.

creator: eagle250@mail.ru
text: Additional information was presented in Comment #2: https://issues.apache.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=46560#c2

The proxy server intercepts the browser request, generates a sampler, and then runs the sampler. The sampler response is then returned to the browser.

So it is not possible for the browser to show the correct response yet have no test elements recorded - the only possibility is that some browser requests are bypassing the proxy. In which case of course they won't be recorded.

Try enabling debug for jmeter.protocol.http.proxy, i.e. add

log_level.jmeter.protocol.http.proxy=DEBUG

to jmeter.properties or user.properties

This will show what lines are being sent to the proxy.
creator: sebb@apache.org

text: This must be due to the browser not using the proxy settings
creator: sebb@apache.org
